newsitem.title: GERMANY: Siemens says environment spending pays off.
newsitem.headline: Siemens says environment spending pays off.

text.p: German electronics group Siemens AG said on Saturday it had invested 225 million marks in environmental protection in 1995 and that its operations had become kinder to the environment as a result.
In its environmental report, Siemens said the investment had been worthwhile, adding that it had cut its energy consumption over the year by 12 percent as a result.

The company said it had cut its electricity bill to 2,215 million kilowatt-hours from 2,438 million in 1994. Thermal energy consumption had been reduced to 2,183 million kilowatt-hours from 2,544 million a year earlier.
Siemens also said the volume of carbon dioxide emitted from its plants had fallen by 8.9 percent to 350,000 tonnes while the volume of non-recyclable waste had fallen by about six percent.
A reduction in sewage of about 10 percent had saved the company around one million marks, the report added.
